snippet: When voters legalized marijuana, they also laid a path for farmers to grow hemp, and Colorado agencies are working to create new rules to regulate cultivation.
abstract: Colorado voters who legalized marijuana for recreational use also approved a measure laying a path for farmers to grow and harvest hemp, a potentially lucrative crop that can be processed into goods as diverse as cooking oil, clothing and building material; hemp cultivation presents a vexing problem for the federal government, which draws no distinction between hemp and marijuana, as it decides how to respond to a new era of legalized marijuana in Colorado and Washington State.
lead_paragraph: When voters legalized marijuana, they also laid a path for farmers to grow hemp, and Colorado agencies are working to create new rules to regulate cultivation.

headline.main: Groundwork Laid, Growers Turn to Hemp in Colorado
headline.print_headline: Groundwork Laid, Growers Turn to Hemp in Colorado
